content.description:
A water tank at Camp Newton holds 1200 gallons of water at time t = 0. During the time interval 0≤t≤18 hours, water is pumped into the tank at the rate  

<math> <mrow> <mi>W</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>95</mn> <msqrt> <mi>t</mi> </msqrt> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>t</mi> <mn>6</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> gallons per hour.

During the same time interval, water is removed from the tank at the rate 

<math> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>275</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> gallons per hour.
content.question: At what time t, 0≤t≤18, is the amount of water in the tank at an absolute minimum? Show the work that leads to your conclusion.

frqParts.text: At what time t, 0≤t≤18, is the amount of water in the tank at an absolute minimum? Show the work that leads to your conclusion.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
